content:
The `destroy()` method in the JobManager class is responsible for properly cleaning up and terminating all resources associated with the job management system. This includes removing any scheduled tasks, clearing out stored references to jobs, and releasing any other allocated resources. The method ensures that when the JobManager is no longer needed, it gracefully shuts down without leaving behind dangling references or active processes that could cause memory leaks or unexpected behavior in the application.

def destroy(self):
        taskMgr.remove(JobManager.TaskName)
        del self._pri2jobId2job
